title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.4-5 | 24-10-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So, something which happened billions of years back, and after that happened, everything was completely annihilated, still, how is it fresh in the mind of Narada?
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains Vyasa Deva's question to Narada Muni about how Narada remembers events from a previous kalpa, even after annihilation.

segments.key_quote: A spirit is not annihilated even after the annihilation of the material body. So also, spiritual consciousness is not annihilated.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains Srila Prabhupada's explanation that the spirit soul and spiritual consciousness are eternal and not destroyed like the material body.

segments.key_quote: Whereas, the spiritual consciousness is not dependent on the condition or the state of the body.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami contrasts material consciousness, which is temporary and dependent on the body, with spiritual consciousness, which is eternal.

segments.key_quote: It is as good as the spirit soul and is never destroyed, never annihilated.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami elaborates on spiritual consciousness as super consciousness, residing on the spiritual plane and being indestructible.

segments.key_quote: The great sages who had imparted scientific knowledge, knowledge of transcendence to me departed for other places and I had to pass my life in this way.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami begins to explain verse 5, where Narada Muni describes how the sages who gave him knowledge departed, and he had to continue his life.

segments.key_quote: When the bona fide spiritual master initiates a person in spiritual knowledge, then there is a visible change, very, very visible and characteristic and significant change that is visible.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains that initiation by a bona fide spiritual master brings about a significant and visible change in a person's life.

segments.key_quote: Whereas the other processes may take millions of lifetimes, bhakti, if properly administered, is possible, spiritual realization is possible in one moment.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains that bhakti yoga brings about quick changes and spiritual realization is possible even in a moment.

segments.key_quote: So Shukadeva Goswami assured him that the method of pure devotional service is very very powerful and even if somebody is able to execute that for a very short time, just even one moment, filled with Krishna Consciousness, is perfection of life achieved in a very short time.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami narrates the story of Parikshit Maharaj and Shukadeva Goswami, emphasizing that pure devotional service can lead to perfection even in a short time.

segments.key_quote: He said, there was one Katvanga Rishi who had only one muhurta time left and he simply fixed his mind upon the lotus feet of the deity form of Krishna in a temple of Krishna.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami narrates the story of Katvanga Rishi, who achieved perfection by meditating on Krishna's lotus feet for one muhurta.

segments.key_quote: So now you sit and hear the Bhagavatam for seven days, fixing your mind on the descriptions of Krishna, which I am now going to narrate. And by doing so, you will achieve perfection very quickly.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami concludes by explaining how Parikshit Maharaj attained perfection by hearing the Bhagavatam and focusing on Krishna, emphasizing the power of hearing and devotion.
